study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether remote ischemic preconditioning (RIPC) could protect liver donors and recipients by improving outcomes such as alanine transaminase levels and reducing complications.
results_summary: RIPC did not significantly improve alanine transaminase levels or reduce early allograft dysfunction, primary nonfunction, or postoperative complications in recipients. Limited protective effects were observed, such as lower creatinine levels in one group.
population_specificity: Living liver donors and pediatric liver transplant recipients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of SGLT inhibitors on lipid metabolism and their efficacy in reducing weight, including the impact on alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: SGLT inhibitors reduced alanine aminotransferase levels, indicating potential hepatoprotective effects, and improved lipid metabolism without significantly altering serum cholesterol levels.
population_specificity: Patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the performance of MET409, a structurally optimized FXR agonist, in patients with NASH, focusing on liver fat reduction and side effect profiles.
results_summary: MET409 significantly reduced liver fat content (55% at 80 mg, 38% at 50 mg) and normalized liver fat in some patients, but increased ALT levels and LDL-C while causing mild-moderate pruritus in a subset of patients.
population_specificity: Patients with non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the association of xanthine oxidoreductase (XOR) and its substrate with vascular complications in Japanese inpatients with type 2 diabetes, including the role of alanine aminotransferase (ALT).
results_summary: Plasma XOR activity and xanthine levels correlated with metabolic markers (e.g., BMI, AST, ALT, HOMA-IR) and vascular complications. XOR activity was lower in patients with coronary artery disease, suggesting it may be a marker for vascular complications and insulin resistance.
population_specificity: 94 Japanese inpatients with type 2 diabetes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the incidence of HBV reactivation-related hepatitis in HBsAg-positive DLBCL patients receiving rituximab-containing chemotherapy and the effectiveness of different anti-HBV prophylactic therapies.
results_summary: The study found that HBsAg-positive patients had a higher 4-year cumulative incidence of HBV reactivation-related hepatitis compared to HBsAg-negative patients, with the highest incidence in the non-NA group. Prophylactic use of entecavir (ETV) significantly reduced HBV reactivation-related hepatitis and mortality.
population_specificity: HBsAg-positive and HBsAg-negative patients with diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL) receiving rituximab-containing chemotherapy.
study_duration: Data collected between January 2004 and December 2014 (retrospective analysis)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of probiotics or symbiotics, including changes in alanine levels, on body weight and serum metabolite profiles in women with obesity.
results_summary: The symbiotic group showed an increase in alanine levels, along with other metabolites, suggesting improved metabolic health. These changes were unique to the symbiotic intervention compared to probiotics or diet alone.
population_specificity: 32 adult women with a BMI of 30-34.9 kg/m²
effective_dosage: Not specified for alanine (probiotic/symbiotic dosage not detailed in abstract)

study_goal: The researchers evaluated the incidence of hepatitis flare, HBV reactivation, and HBsAg seroclearance/seroreversion in patients with current or past HBV infection receiving immunotherapy.
results_summary: Hepatitis flare occurred in 39.3% of HBsAg-positive and 30.4% of HBsAg-negative patients during immunotherapy. HBV reactivation, HBsAg seroclearance, and seroreversion were rare (<1%).
population_specificity: Patients with current or past HBV infection in Hong Kong receiving immunotherapy (990 total: 397 HBsAg-positive, 593 HBsAg-negative).
study_duration: Data collected from July 1, 2014, to December 31, 2019 (observational period).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the long-term safety and efficacy of REP 2139-Ca and pegIFN in achieving functional cure for HBV/HDV coinfection, including monitoring alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels as a marker of liver health.
results_summary: The study found that HDV functional cure persisted in 7 of 11 participants, HBV virologic control persisted in 3, and functional cure with HBsAg seroconversion persisted in 4 participants. Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels normalized in participants achieving functional cure, indicating improved liver health.
population_specificity: Participants with HBV/HDV coinfection who completed therapy in the REP 301 study.

study_goal: The study aimed to assess the non-inferiority of posaconazole to voriconazole for the primary treatment of invasive aspergillosis, not specifically focused on Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that posaconazole was non-inferior to voriconazole in terms of all-cause mortality up to day 42, with fewer treatment-related adverse events in the posaconazole group. Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) elevation was noted as a frequent adverse event in both groups.
population_specificity: Participants aged 13 years or older, weighing at least 40 kg, with proven, probable, or possible invasive aspergillosis from 91 study sites in 26 countries.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study focused on posaconazole and voriconazole, not Alanine).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the characteristics of COVID-19 patients in the early stage of the pandemic and explore risk factors of disease progression, including the role of specific laboratory indicators like alanine aminotransferase (ALT).
results_summary: The study found that elevated ALT levels were associated with disease severity in COVID-19 patients, suggesting a potential link between liver function markers and worse clinical outcomes. However, the abstract does not specifically address the efficacy or safety of alanine supplementation.
population_specificity: COVID-19 patients (16,526 individuals across 90 studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the association between high BMI and disease severity in imported COVID-19 patients, including the role of biochemical indicators like alanine aminotransferase (ALT).
results_summary: Elevated ALT was identified as an independent risk factor associated with high BMI in COVID-19 patients, suggesting a potential link between liver injury and disease severity in this population.
population_specificity: Imported COVID-19 patients in Zhejiang province, China, with BMI ≥ 24 or < 24.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of combination therapy (entecavir or tenofovir with Peg-IFNα) on long-term reduction in HBsAg levels in chronic HBV infection.
results_summary: Some studies showed promising results for combination therapy, but there is no robust evidence that it is superior to monotherapy. Large studies are needed to assess long-term safety and efficacy for increasing HBsAg seroclearance rates.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection.

study_goal: The study aimed to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) and recommended phase II dose (RP2D) of ribociclib and everolimus in pediatric patients, including assessing ribociclib concentrations in plasma and tumor tissue.
results_summary: The study found that ribociclib and everolimus were generally well-tolerated, but grade 4 alanine aminotransferase elevation was observed as a dose-limiting toxicity in some patients. Potential therapeutic ribociclib concentrations were achieved in CSF and tumor tissue, though with interpatient variability.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients (median age 10.3 years, range 3.9-20.4) with brain tumors.
effective_dosage: Ribociclib at 350 mg/m² (surgical cohort) and RP2D of ribociclib (120 mg/m²) and everolimus (1.2 mg/m²).
study_duration: Ribociclib administered daily for 21 days and everolimus for 28 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze clinical and biological characteristics, including alanine aminotransferase (ALAT) levels, in COVID-19 patients to identify factors predictive of disease severity.
results_summary: Elevated ALAT levels during admission and hospitalization were strongly associated with progression to severe COVID-19, suggesting its potential as a biomarker for disease severity. The study did not evaluate alanine as a supplement but rather as a clinical marker.
population_specificity: 134 hospitalized COVID-19 patients (median age 53 years, 54.5% male) from the North African Mediterranean region.

study_goal: The researchers were not evaluating Alanine; the study focused on comparing the efficacy and safety of sitafloxacin versus moxifloxacin in treating community-acquired pneumonia (CAP).
results_summary: The study did not investigate Alanine; it found that sitafloxacin was non-inferior to moxifloxacin in clinical efficacy for adult CAP patients.
population_specificity: Chinese adults with community-acquired pneumonia (CAP)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the diagnostic significance of carbohydrate-deficient transferrin (CDT) in chronic alcoholism, comparing it with other biochemical markers including alanine aminotransferase (ALT).
results_summary: The study found that CDT was a better indicator of alcoholism compared to ALT and other markers, with higher diagnostic accuracy (AUC 0.922). However, the correlation between CDT and daily alcohol consumption was weak.
population_specificity: Chinese population, including healthy subjects, nonalcoholic liver disease patients, and alcoholics.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the incidence of liver injury in transgender individuals using gender-affirming hormone therapy, focusing on liver enzyme levels including alanine aminotransferase (ALT).
results_summary: The study found a very low incidence of liver injury (0.1-0.6%) in transgender individuals within 12 months of hormone therapy, with no significant safety concerns related to ALT elevation. Liver enzyme monitoring was deemed unnecessary for this population.
population_specificity: 1933 transgender individuals (889 transgender women and 1044 transgender men).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the efficacy and safety of tenofovir disoproxil fumarate in reducing disease progression in patients with chronic hepatitis B and minimally raised alanine aminotransferase (ALT).
results_summary: Tenofovir disoproxil fumarate significantly reduced liver fibrosis progression (26% vs. 47% in placebo) and showed a non-significant trend in reducing necroinflammation (7% vs. 16% in placebo). Acute hepatitis flare requiring rescue therapy was less frequent in the treatment group (3% vs. 16%).
population_specificity: Patients aged 25-70 with chronic hepatitis B, substantial viraemia, and minimally raised ALT (1-2x ULN), excluding those with liver cirrhosis or prior antiviral treatment.
effective_dosage: 300 mg oral tenofovir disoproxil fumarate once daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of dietary interventions, including those affecting alanine aminotransferase levels, on hepatic steatosis and metabolic parameters in adults and elderly with NAFLD.
results_summary: The study found that hypocaloric diets had effects on hepatic steatosis and serum alanine aminotransferase levels, while reduced macronutrient interventions showed no efficacy. Only 3 of the 10 studies had a low risk of bias.
population_specificity: Adults and elderly (age ≥ 60 years) with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).

study_goal: The study aimed to assess the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics, and preliminary anti-tumor activity of BAT8001, a novel antibody-drug conjugate, in HER2-positive breast cancer patients.
results_summary: The study found that BAT8001 had a favorable safety profile with dose-limiting toxicities including thrombocytopenia and elevated transaminase. Preliminary anti-tumor activity was observed, with an objective response rate of 41.4% and disease control in 82.8% of patients.
population_specificity: Patients with HER2-positive locally advanced or metastatic breast cancer (Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status of 0 or 1).
effective_dosage: 1.2, 2.4, 3.6, 4.8, and 6.0 mg/kg intravenously in a 21-day cycle.
study_duration: From March 2017 to May 2018 (exact duration per patient not specified).

study_goal: The researchers were investigating the role of cation-chloride cotransporters (CCCs) in stroke and their potential as pharmacological targets.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings regarding Alanine's effects. It mentions CCCs' involvement in physiological functions like chloride homeostasis but does not detail results related to Alanine.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify predictors of biochemical and histological remission in patients with autoimmune hepatitis (AIH), focusing on serum IgG levels and liver fibrosis.
results_summary: Lower serum IgG levels, less liver fibrosis at diagnosis, and rapid response to immunosuppressive therapy were reliable predictors of remission. Patients achieving remission had lower IgG levels and faster biochemical response times.
population_specificity: 705 patients with autoimmune hepatitis (AIH).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether a standardized extract of Nasturtium officinale (SENO) could improve or maintain serum lipid and oxidative stress markers in overweight individuals.
results_summary: SENO significantly improved low-density lipoprotein cholesterol, creatinine, and lipid peroxidation levels but did not significantly affect total serum cholesterol, triacylglycerol, high-density lipoprotein, or other oxidative stress and liver enzyme markers.
population_specificity: Overweight individuals with physical disabilities.

study_goal: The researchers sought to examine the potential role of liver fibrosis scores (LFSs), including those involving alanine aminotransferase (ALT), in predicting long-term cardiovascular outcomes in patients with stable coronary artery disease after elective PCI.
results_summary: Higher LFSs, including those involving ALT ratios, were associated with significantly increased risk of cardiovascular events. Adding LFSs to established risk models improved predictive ability for adverse outcomes.
population_specificity: 4003 patients with stable coronary artery disease undergoing elective PCI.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify altered metabolic pathways, including alanine metabolism, in Alzheimer's disease (AD) to understand pathophysiological mechanisms and potential therapeutic targets.
results_summary: The study found altered expression of alanine and related metabolites in AD, suggesting disrupted metabolic pathways, but did not establish direct therapeutic effects of alanine supplementation.
population_specificity: AD subjects and animal models of AD.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and antitumor activity of mavorixafor (a CXCR4 inhibitor) in combination with nivolumab for metastatic clear cell renal cell carcinoma (ccRCC) patients unresponsive to nivolumab monotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that mavorixafor combined with nivolumab showed potential antitumor activity, with one partial response and stabilization of disease in previously progressive patients. However, treatment-related adverse events, including elevated alanine aminotransferase, led to discontinuation in some patients.
population_specificity: Patients with metastatic clear cell renal cell carcinoma (ccRCC) unresponsive to nivolumab monotherapy (median age 65 years).
effective_dosage: Mavorixafor 400 mg daily plus nivolumab 240 mg intravenously every 2 weeks.
study_duration: Median duration of response was 6.7 months (range: 3.7-14.7).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate risk factors for ARDS in patients with severe acute pancreatitis (SAP), not specifically focusing on Alanine.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in alanine aminotransferase levels between SAP patients with and without ARDS, indicating Alanine was not a significant factor in ARDS development.
population_specificity: 281 SAP patients treated in a hospital from June 2018 to May 2020.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the prolonged efficacy and safety of besifovir dipivoxil maleate (BSV) in treatment-naive chronic hepatitis B patients, including those who switched from tenofovir disoproxil fumarate (TDF) to BSV.
results_summary: BSV maintained potent antiviral efficacy over 192 weeks with no drug-resistant mutations, preserved bone mineral density and renal function, and showed comparable virological response rates between BSV-BSV and TDF-BSV groups. Safety profiles were favorable, with initial worsening then recovery in the TDF-BSV group after switching therapy.
population_specificity: Treatment-naive chronic hepatitis B patients.

study_goal: The researchers were evaluating the safety and recommended dose of olaratumab in combination with chemotherapy regimens in children with relapsed/refractory solid or central nervous system tumors.
results_summary: The study found that olaratumab was tolerable and safely administered in combination with chemotherapy, with some dose-limiting toxicities observed. There were a few partial and complete responses, primarily in rhabdomyosarcoma and pineoblastoma cases.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents (<18 years) with relapsed/refractory solid or central nervous system tumors.
effective_dosage: 15 mg/kg or 20 mg/kg on Days 1 and 8 of the first 21-day cycle, followed by combination therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of crizotinib monotherapy in patients with alectinib-refractory, EML4-ALK-positive NSCLC, focusing on the role of MET pathway activation in resistance.
results_summary: The study found a 33.3% overall response rate to crizotinib, which did not meet predefined criteria, with median progression-free survival of 2.2 months and median survival time of 24.1 months. Adverse events included increased AST/ALT ratio (44%) and appetite loss (33%), with one case of grade 4 AST/ALT elevation leading to discontinuation.
population_specificity: Patients with ALK-rearranged, alectinib-refractory, EML4-ALK-positive NSCLC.
study_duration: Median treatment interval of 50 days (range: 20-433 days)

study_goal: The researchers were examining the role of glutamine metabolism in cancer cells, particularly focusing on the transporter ASCT2, which mediates the uptake of alanine, serine, and cysteine.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that increased glutaminolysis in cancer cells is linked to higher expression of ASCT2, suggesting a potential metabolic dependency on glutamine and related amino acids like alanine for cancer cell survival and proliferation.
population_specificity: Cancer cells (in vitro or preclinical context, not specified further).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of BMI on the efficacy and safety of tofacitinib in patients with active psoriatic arthritis.
results_summary: Tofacitinib showed greater efficacy than placebo in patients with PsA, regardless of baseline BMI, though reduced efficacy was observed in patients with BMI ≥35 kg/m².
population_specificity: Patients with active psoriatic arthritis (N=710).
effective_dosage: Tofacitinib 5 mg or 10 mg twice daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review novel PEG-mimetic peptides, including proline/alanine/serine repeat sequences, for enhancing the pharmacokinetic profile of therapeutic proteins.
results_summary: The study highlights that proline/alanine/serine repeat sequences offer advantages such as biodegradability, low immunogenicity, product homogeneity, and a simple production process, making them a preferred technology for extending the plasma half-life of therapeutic proteins.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing technologies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of silymarin in reducing transaminase levels (including alanine aminotransferase) in individuals with NAFLD.
results_summary: Silymarin treatment significantly reduced transaminase levels compared to placebo, irrespective of weight loss, though the study noted potential flaws in the quality of included trials.
population_specificity: Individuals with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the maximum tolerated dose, preliminary efficacy, and pharmacokinetics of intravenous lipid emulsion fenretinide in patients with advanced solid tumors.
results_summary: The study found that fenretinide emulsion had a manageable safety profile but minimal single-agent activity, with five patients achieving stable disease and no objective responses. Plasma steady-state concentrations of the active metabolite were significantly higher than with previous capsule formulations.
population_specificity: Patients with advanced solid tumors refractory to standard treatments.
effective_dosage: Five different dose cohorts evaluated between 905 mg/m² (specific frequency not detailed).
study_duration: Continuous infusion for five consecutive days in 21-day cycles.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate clinical characteristics and risk factors for severe COVID-19 cases, including abnormal laboratory findings such as alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: The study found that 28% of severe COVID-19 patients had increased alanine aminotransferase levels, indicating potential liver dysfunction. No direct effects or outcomes related to alanine supplementation were assessed.
population_specificity: Severe COVID-19 patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of intracoronary autologous bone marrow mesenchymal stem cell (BM-MSC) transplantation in patients with ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI), including monitoring alanine transaminase (ALT) levels.
results_summary: The study found no significant improvement in myocardial activity or LV function with BM-MSC transplantation compared to controls. ALT levels in the BM-MSC group were significantly lower than in the control group, but no direct efficacy of alanine was assessed.
population_specificity: Patients aged 39-76 years with STEMI from six hospitals in Beijing.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of sofosbuvir/velpatasvir (SOF/VEL) with or without low-dose ribavirin (RBV) in HCV-infected patients with severe renal impairment.
results_summary: The study found that SOF/VEL with or without low-dose RBV was effective and well-tolerated in HCV-infected patients with severe renal impairment, achieving sustained virological response at off-treatment week 12 (SVR12).
population_specificity: Patients with chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection and severe renal impairment (chronic kidney disease stage 4 or 5), including those with compensated (n=181) and decompensated (n=10) liver diseases.
effective_dosage: SOF/VEL (400/100 mg/day) alone or with low-dose RBV (200 mg/day).

study_goal: The study aimed to identify parameters influencing micafungin pharmacokinetics in Chinese sepsis patients and optimize dosage for pharmacodynamic targets.
results_summary: Alanine aminotransferase significantly influenced micafungin clearance. Higher micafungin doses (200-300 mg daily) were needed to achieve effective plasma levels against certain Candida species.
population_specificity: 32 Chinese patients with sepsis in the intensive care unit.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of tenofovir alafenamide fumarate (TAF) during pregnancy for preventing mother-to-child transmission of hepatitis B virus (HBV).
results_summary: TAF was well tolerated with minimal adverse effects (e.g., nausea in 19.0% of mothers) and no birth defects in infants. The HBsAg-positive rate in infants was 0% at 7 months, demonstrating high efficacy in preventing HBV transmission.
population_specificity: Pregnant women with HBV DNA levels >200,000 IU/mL and their infants.
study_duration: Mean treatment duration of 11.0 weeks (from gestational weeks 24-35 to delivery).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Tripterygium wilfordii Hook F. (TwHF) in treating osteoarticular lesions in SAPHO syndrome, with a focus on changes in disease activity scores.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in disease activity scores (ASDAS) and other efficacy measures in both dose groups, with maximum efficacy achieved within 2-4 weeks. One patient experienced severe alanine aminotransferase elevation, leading to discontinuation of treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with SAPHO syndrome.

study_goal: The study aimed to investigate the effect of adding everolimus to letrozole in ovarian-suppressed premenopausal women with HR+, HER2- recurrent/metastatic breast cancer, not specifically focused on Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that everolimus plus letrozole with ovarian suppression resulted in longer progression-free survival in patients with visceral metastasis. Alanine aminotransferase elevation was noted as a common grade 3/4 adverse event in the everolimus arm.
population_specificity: Premenopausal women with HR+, HER2- recurrent/metastatic breast cancer, median age 44 years.
study_duration: Until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity (median follow-up 32.4 months).

study_goal: The study aimed to estimate the effect of isoniazid preventive therapy with antiretroviral therapy (ART) on tuberculosis prevention and mortality among people with HIV, not specifically focused on Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that isoniazid preventive therapy with ART reduced tuberculosis risk (HR 0·68) but did not significantly reduce mortality (HR 0·69). Alanine aminotransferase elevation was noted in 2.5% of participants, but no detailed analysis was provided.
population_specificity: HIV-positive adults (age ≥15 years) on ART.
study_duration: Follow-up duration varied, with up to 8584·8 person-years for tuberculosis outcomes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of anticoagulants, including their impact on alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels, in animal models of chronic liver diseases.
results_summary: The study found that anticoagulants reduced ALT levels (mean difference = -82.7) and other markers of hepatic injury, suggesting a potential antifibrotic effect, but had no impact on animal survival.
population_specificity: Animal models of chronic liver diseases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety profile of EGFR-TKIs, including adverse events like increased alanine aminotransferase (ALT), in cancer patients.
results_summary: The study found that increased ALT (38.9%) was one of the most frequently observed all-grade adverse events in patients treated with EGFR-TKIs. However, the abstract does not specifically evaluate the safety or efficacy of alanine itself.
population_specificity: Patients with various cancers enrolled in randomized controlled trials (17,800 patients across 28 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of ursodeoxycholic acid (UDCA) in lowering alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels in patients with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that UDCA treatment significantly reduced ALT levels (p=0.007), with notable effects in European populations, individuals over 50, and longer-duration studies. However, further validation is needed to confirm UDCA's efficacy in NAFLD.
population_specificity: Patients with NAFLD, specifically subgroups from Europe and those older than 50 years.
study_duration: Longer-duration subgroup showed significant effects (exact duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the long-term safety of tolvaptan, particularly focusing on liver enzyme elevations (including alanine aminotransferase) in patients with autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease (ADPKD).
results_summary: The study found that while liver enzyme elevations (ALT/AST) were common, no new safety signals emerged, and monthly monitoring effectively managed transaminase elevations. Tolvaptan maintained its efficacy in slowing kidney function decline over long-term use.
population_specificity: Patients with autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease (ADPKD) at risk of rapid progression.
study_duration: Median exposure was 651 days (interquartile range, 538-924), with cumulative exposure up to 11 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the maximum tolerated dose, pharmacokinetics, and safety profile of rucaparib in combination with bevacizumab, not specifically Alanine.
results_summary: The study found increased alanine aminotransferase levels as a dose-limiting toxicity in the 600-mg rucaparib group, but Alanine itself was not the focus of the study.
population_specificity: Patients with high-grade epithelial ovarian, fallopian tube, or primary peritoneal cancer.
study_duration: 28 days for rucaparib, with bevacizumab administered every 21 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine real-world safety data, including laboratory test abnormalities and adverse health conditions, in new users of oral multiple sclerosis disease-modifying therapies (DMTs), with a focus on alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels.
results_summary: The study found that the short-term incidences of abnormal laboratory results, such as elevated ALT, were consistent with findings from pivotal clinical trials. Longer-term safety data were noted as still needed.
population_specificity: Persons with multiple sclerosis (PwMS) in two Canadian provinces who were new users of oral DMTs.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, pharmacokinetics, and antitumor activity of ASP3026, a second-generation ALK inhibitor, in Japanese patients with solid tumors.
results_summary: The study found that ASP3026 had a tolerable safety profile at a 200-mg dose, with common adverse events including nausea, decreased appetite, and fatigue. Partial responses were observed in two patients, one with Ewing sarcoma and another with an ALKr-positive inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor.
population_specificity: Japanese patients with solid tumors.
effective_dosage: Daily doses of 25 mg, 50 mg, 75 mg, 125 mg, 200 mg, or 325 mg.
study_duration: The study was conducted between 1 June 2011 and 20 January 2014.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of statins and fibrates on laboratory parameters, including alanine aminotransferase (ALT), in Japanese patients with dyslipidemia.
results_summary: The study found that fibrates had a greater effect on reducing ALT levels compared to statins, with a statistically significant difference (P=0.003). No significant differences were observed in aspartate aminotransferase levels between the two drug groups.
population_specificity: Japanese patients with dyslipidemia newly treated with statin or fibrate monotherapy.

study_goal: The study aimed to compare the overall survival benefit of dacomitinib versus gefitinib in patients with advanced NSCLC and EGFR-activating mutations.
results_summary: The study found that dacomitinib significantly improved overall survival compared to gefitinib, with a hazard ratio of 0.748 and median OS of 34.1 months versus 27.0 months. Common adverse events included diarrhea, paronychia, and dermatitis acneiform for dacomitinib, and diarrhea and increased alanine aminotransferase for gefitinib.
population_specificity: Adults (aged ≥18 years or ≥20 years in Japan and Korea) with newly diagnosed NSCLC and EGFR mutation (exon 19 deletion or exon 21 L858R substitution), and no history of central nervous system metastases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a formulated food containing prebiotics and dietary fiber could improve NAFLD by altering intestinal microbiota and its metabolites, including potential effects on alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: The study planned to assess the efficacy of the formulated food in reducing liver fat (MRS-PDFF) by over 30% and improving liver function, glycolipid metabolism, and systemic inflammation over 24 weeks, with follow-up until week 36. Changes in intestinal microbiota abundance and diversity were also explored.
population_specificity: Adult patients (18-75 years) with NAFLD and alanine aminotransferase levels 1.5 to 5 times the upper limit of normal or biopsy-confirmed NASH (n=120).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare clinical manifestations and laboratory findings, including alanine transaminase levels, between COVID-19 patients from the East and the West.
results_summary: The study found that COVID-19 patients from the West had significantly higher levels of alanine transaminase compared to those from the East, indicating more severe liver damage in Western patients. No direct efficacy or safety assessment of alanine as a supplement was conducted.
population_specificity: COVID-19 patients from East and South-East Asian countries (East cohort) and North American, European, and Middle Eastern countries (West cohort).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether increased IL-18 levels are associated with NAFLD and liver injury in people with HIV (PWH).
results_summary: The study found that PWH had higher levels of IL-18, AST, and ALT compared to controls, suggesting a potential link between IL-18 and liver injury in this population. However, the abstract does not specifically address the effects of alanine.
population_specificity: People with HIV (PWH) and individuals without HIV in the Boston area.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze laboratory values, including alanine aminotransferase, in transgender patients undergoing hormone therapy to determine when these values stabilize and their long-term impacts.
results_summary: The study found that alanine aminotransferase levels increased beyond 1 year in transgender men undergoing hormone therapy, indicating a long-term change in this analyte.
population_specificity: Transgender women (126) and transgender men (91) undergoing hormone therapy.

study_goal: The study aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of abiraterone acetate plus prednisolone in patients with early metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer, focusing on prostate-specific antigen response and survival outcomes.
results_summary: The study found a prostate-specific antigen response rate of 55.1%, with median progression-free survival of 24.1 weeks and overall survival of 102.9 weeks. The most common adverse event was nasopharyngitis (30.0%), and the most common severe adverse event was increased alanine aminotransferase (12.0%).
population_specificity: Patients with chemotherapy-naïve early metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer who failed first-line androgen deprivation therapy.
effective_dosage: Abiraterone acetate (1000 mg) plus prednisolone (10 mg).
study_duration: Median duration of initial androgen deprivation therapy was 32.4 weeks (range: 13.4-84.1 weeks).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the safety and efficacy of liraglutide in patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), focusing on changes in hepatic fat content and alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels.
results_summary: Liraglutide showed a non-significant decrease in hepatic fat content and ALT levels, a significant reduction in body mass index (primarily in type 2 diabetes patients), and a decrease in serum triglyceride levels, but no significant impact on other metabolic parameters. It was associated with increased gastrointestinal adverse events.
population_specificity: Patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), including those with type 2 diabetes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the relationship between end-of-treatment levels of hepatitis B core-related antigen (HBcrAg) and hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) and outcomes after nucleo(s)tide analogue (NA) therapy cessation, including alanine aminotransferase (ALT) flares.
results_summary: Lower HBcrAg and HBsAg levels were associated with higher rates of sustained virologic response and HBsAg loss, and lower rates of ALT flares. The SCALE-B score, incorporating these factors, effectively stratified risk for outcomes post-therapy cessation.
population_specificity: 572 patients (80% Asian, 17% hepatitis B e antigen positive at therapy start) from centers in Asia and Europe.

study_goal: The researchers compared the epidemiological and clinical characteristics of SARS-CoV-2 infection between adults and children, not specifically related to Alanine.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in epidemiological exposure history, clinical classification, symptoms, chest CT manifestations, or SARS-CoV-2-positive days between children and adults, though adults had a higher percentage of neutrophils.
population_specificity: 52 patients with COVID-19 (38 adults and 14 children).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the frequency of hepatotoxicity based on liver chemistry in children with juvenile idiopathic arthritis (JIA) receiving methotrexate (MTX).
results_summary: The study found that 28% of children receiving MTX developed hepatotoxicity, with higher ALT and AST levels and lower ALP levels compared to controls. No significant differences were observed in age, sex, weight, JIA type, or MTX treatment duration.
population_specificity: Children with juvenile idiopathic arthritis (JIA) attending the Pediatric Rheumatology Unit, Cairo University Pediatric Hospital, Egypt.
study_duration: Data were collected from January 2018 to December 2018 (exact treatment duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the durability of HBV suppression in HIV-HBV co-infected patients treated with lamivudine alone or lamivudine-tenofovir, focusing on baseline HBV DNA levels.
results_summary: The study found that lamivudine alone provided durable HBV suppression (up to 5 years) in patients with baseline HBV DNA <6 log10 IU/mL, while lamivudine-tenofovir was more effective for those with higher baseline HBV DNA. Viral rebound was rare (8%) in suppressed patients, and no alanine transaminase flares were observed.
population_specificity: HIV-HBV co-infected adults in Uganda and Zimbabwe.

study_goal: The study does not assess Alanine; it evaluates pembrolizumab plus axitinib versus sunitinib for advanced renal cell carcinoma.
results_summary: The study does not report findings on Alanine.
population_specificity: Patients with treatment-naive, advanced renal cell carcinoma with clear cell histology.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) as a biomarker for treatment response and remission in autoimmune hepatitis (AIH).
results_summary: The study found that prolonged and stringent biochemical remission, indicated by lower ALT levels and normal IgG, may allow some AIH patients to discontinue medications. ALT normalization is essential for long-term survival in AIH treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with autoimmune hepatitis (AIH), including chronic and acute-onset subtypes.

study_goal: The researchers were evaluating the safety and dosing of niraparib (NIR) in combination with temozolomide (TMZ) or irinotecan (IRN) in patients with pretreated Ewing sarcoma, not specifically studying alanine.
results_summary: The study found that the combination of NIR with TMZ or IRN was tolerable but required lower doses than conventional cytotoxic combinations. One patient experienced grade 3 alanine aminotransferase elevation as a dose-limiting toxicity in arm 2.
population_specificity: Patients with pretreated Ewing sarcoma (23 males and 6 females).
effective_dosage: NIR at 200 mg daily (days 1-7) plus TMZ at 30 mg/m² (days 2-6).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy of bicyclol, including its impact on alanine transaminase (ALT) levels, in improving liver function and blood lipid biomarkers in patients with NAFLD.
results_summary: Bicyclol significantly reduced ALT and AST levels, improved liver function, and showed a higher total effective rate compared to the control group, with no serious adverse events reported.
population_specificity: Patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the efficacy and safety of Saroglitazar in patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and diabetic dyslipidemia (DD), focusing on its impact on liver enzymes like alanine transaminase (ALT).
results_summary: The study found significant reductions in ALT, AST, liver stiffness measurement (LSM), and controlled attenuation parameter (CAP) after 24 weeks of Saroglitazar treatment, along with improvements in glycated hemoglobin and lipid parameters.
population_specificity: Patients with diabetic dyslipidemia and NAFLD (mean age 50.4 years, 78.5% males, mean BMI 28.8).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of vitamin E in treating paediatric non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), including its impact on alanine transaminase (ALT) levels.
results_summary: The study found that vitamin E did not significantly alter ALT levels or other liver function indicators, though it improved blood lipids (LDL and total cholesterol). Fasting glucose levels increased with vitamin E treatment if the intervention lasted ≤12 months.
population_specificity: Children with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).
study_duration: Varied (≤12 months noted for fasting glucose effect)

study_goal: The study aimed to investigate the antitumour activity of GX-188E therapeutic DNA vaccine plus pembrolizumab in patients with recurrent or advanced cervical cancer, not specifically Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that the combination therapy showed preliminary antitumour activity, with 42% of evaluable patients achieving an overall response. Treatment-related adverse events were manageable, with no treatment-related deaths reported.
population_specificity: Patients with recurrent or advanced, inoperable HPV-positive (HPV-16 or HPV-18) cervical cancer who had progressed after standard therapy.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study did not focus on Alanine).
study_duration: Up to 2 years or until disease progression.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether resveratrol supplementation affects alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and aspartate aminotransferase (AST) levels in patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).
results_summary: The meta-analysis found no significant overall effect of resveratrol supplementation on ALT or AST levels in NAFLD patients, though subgroup analyses showed reductions in younger participants, lower dosages, longer durations, and those with BMI <30 kg/m².
population_specificity: Patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).
effective_dosage: Subgroup analysis included studies with dosages <1000 mg/day.
study_duration: Studies with durations >12 weeks showed significant effects.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to consolidate evidence on the association between SGLT2 inhibitors and improved liver functions, including effects on alanine aminotransferase, in patients with type 2 diabetes and NAFLD.
results_summary: Five systematic reviews indicated that SGLT2 inhibitors effectively decreased liver fat and liver parameters like alanine aminotransferase and gamma-glutamyl transferase in NAFLD patients. However, no evidence of liver fibrosis improvement was found, and the methodological quality of the reviews was relatively low.
population_specificity: Patients with type 2 diabetes and non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).

study_goal: The study aimed to evaluate the effects of convalescent plasma therapy in patients with severe COVID-19 pneumonia, not Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that convalescent plasma therapy improved clinical outcomes in 58.3% of patients and increased lymphocyte counts, but it did not assess Alanine.
population_specificity: 24 patients with severe COVID-19 pneumonia in Wuhan, China.
effective_dosage: Not mentioned (study focused on convalescent plasma, not Alanine).
study_duration: Not specified (study duration not clearly stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review GI symptoms and liver-related biomarkers, including alanine aminotransferase levels, in COVID-19 patients.
results_summary: The study found increased alanine aminotransferase levels in some COVID-19 patients, suggesting potential hepatic involvement, but did not focus on alanine's therapeutic effects.
population_specificity: SARS-CoV-2-infected individuals (18,246 patients across 43 studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of baseline liver function, including alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels, on COVID-19-related outcomes such as mortality, ICU admissions, and severe complications.
results_summary: Elevated ALT levels (> upper limit of normal) were associated with an increased prevalence of severe COVID-19 complications (OR: 2.15 [95% CI, 1.43-3.23]) and showed a specificity of 77%. The mean difference in ALT levels between mild and severe COVID-19 cases was 8 U/l (95% CI, 1.0-15).
population_specificity: Patients affected by SARS-CoV-2 (COVID-19).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of pitavastatin in real-world clinical practice for patients with hyperlipidemia.
results_summary: Pitavastatin demonstrated a dose-dependent reduction in LDL cholesterol (-23.4% to -35.2%) and was well tolerated, with only 1.74% of patients experiencing adverse events and minimal serious toxicity.
population_specificity: Korean patients aged 20 or older with hyperlipidemia.
study_duration: Mean duration of 126 days (at least 8 weeks).
